result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary Ann Hoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mary Ann Hoff is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mary Ann Hoff was found guilty of Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to pay fine and costs within 60 days. If not paid, one day in jail for each $50.00 of unpaid fines. Bond to be applied.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defense makes argument. Court grants amendment of count 1. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant KVI waives all rights and enters NC plea to amended count 1. Court finds defendant G of amended count 1. Defendant sentenced. Count 2 is dismissed.
